entry.title: Why I Chose Blogofile as my Blogging Platform
entry.summary: Why I Chose Blogofile as my Blogging Platform
entry.content:
First of all, what if "Blogofile"? The definition from the original website says:

Definition: Blogofile (n): A static website compiler and blog engine, written and extended in Python.

Static website compiler means that each time we want to make an change to the website I have to recompile it, which is a big word for saying that I have to regenerate the html files. The advantage of this, if it is not obvious yet is that we host only the produced html files. No special web framework is need. No need for CGI, php or java access on the server. All you need is a web server that can serve static content.

When I studied at the Technion, students received small space where they could host a website. The server was very limited, and could serve static content only. So in such situations Blogofile is prefect.

entry.title: Syntax highlight test
entry.content:
This post contains some highlighted python code:

import this

if __name__ == "main":
    print "Hello, World!"

entry.title: Post 3 - Unicode Test - How about some 日本語テスト
entry.summary: Post 3 - Unicode Test - How about some 日本語テスト
entry.content:
Anglo-Saxon Rune Poem:

ᚠᛇᚻ᛫ᛒᛦᚦ᛫ᚠᚱᚩᚠᚢᚱ᛫ᚠᛁᚱᚪ᛫ᚷᛖᚻᚹᛦᛚᚳᚢᛗ ᛋᚳᛖᚪᛚ᛫ᚦᛖᚪᚻ᛫ᛗᚪᚾᚾᚪ᛫ᚷᛖᚻᚹᛦᛚᚳ᛫ᛗᛁᚳᛚᚢᚾ᛫ᚻᛦᛏ᛫ᛞᚫᛚᚪᚾ ᚷᛁᚠ᛫ᚻᛖ᛫ᚹᛁᛚᛖ᛫ᚠᚩᚱ᛫ᛞᚱᛁᚻᛏᚾᛖ᛫ᛞᚩᛗᛖᛋ᛫ᚻᛚᛇᛏᚪᚾ᛬

Tamil poetry:

யாமறிந்த மொழிகளிலே தமிழ்மொழி போல் இனிதாவது எங்கும் காணோம், பாமரராய் விலங்குகளாய், உலகனைத்தும் இகழ்ச்சிசொலப் பான்மை கெட்டு, நாமமது தமிழரெனக் கொண்டு இங்கு வாழ்ந்திடுதல் நன்றோ? சொல்லீர்! தேமதுரத் தமிழோசை உலகமெலாம் பரவும்வகை செய்தல் வேண்டும்.

I can eat glass: 私はガラスを食べられます。それは私を傷つけません。 Կրնամ ապակի ուտել և ինծի անհանգիստ չըներ։ I kå Glas frässa, ond des macht mr nix! ᚛᚛ᚉᚑᚅᚔᚉᚉᚔᚋ ᚔᚈᚔ ᚍᚂᚐᚅᚑ ᚅᚔᚋᚌᚓᚅᚐ᚜ אני יכול לאכול זכוכית וזה לא מזיק לי काचं शक्नोम्यत्तुम् । नोपहिनस्ति माम् ॥
